title: Newbie looking for teacher
body: Hello, I'm level 15 in League and am looking for a teacher. I'm just learning about all the roles and would love someone to help me learn one of them, jungle and support looks the most fun to me! I also haven't found a main champion yet if that's alright

replies.body: Hm I'm pretty busy these days, but feel free to add me.  I'm always willing to help new players.  :)

Hey this may be a bit too early for you, but once you come to terms with how the roles are played, and all that, I did write this pretty extensive guide that should help you understand what you might, and what you might be missing.

It contains around 80% of what you need to know about the laning phase, and 95 % if you're playing in bottom lane.
forget everything you learned so far, Every champion can fill every role, the only difference is some will have easier time then others in those so called roles.

This is misleading and inaccurate. Not only is the difference in in difficulty to fill off-roles on most champs massive, but your overall potential in that role will be far less than if you stuck to something that made sense. Assassin soraka isn't a thing, support akali isn't a thing, jungle ryze isn't a thing...
Would people get mad at you?
player who still haven't understand it yes which comprise about 90% of the community.
FIX THE TROLL PROBLEMS

For a map to look at [click here](http://promo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/srmapexperience/).
[Common ward spots map](https://www.google.com.au/search?q=vision+in+the+jungle+League+of+Legends+ward+maps&es_sm=119&biw=1258&bih=683&tbm=isch&imgil=45-8Y5aW11IfOM%253A%253BXrf3nz9iV_fAvM%253Bhttps%25253A%25252F%25252Fwww.reddit.com%25252Fr%25252Fsummonerschool%25252Fcomments%25252F33i3dl%25252Fthe_strategy_of_ward_locations%25252F&source=iu&pf=m&fir=45-8Y5aW11IfOM%253A%252CXrf3nz9iV_fAvM%252C_&usg=__Cji1se2EyjZtbvDg8yAQAWMh36A%3D&ved=0CCwQyjdqFQoTCO3Yh4CImsgCFcwflAodAvcJwg&ei=JF8JVu22G8y_0ASC7qeQDA#imgrc=PS31kpSi4MK93M%3A&usg=__Cji1se2EyjZtbvDg8yAQAWMh36A%3D).

Vision is incredibly important in League. If you are the support then it is your job to protect your ADC and that includes protecting them against Rengars that might jump out of brushes. The team who wards more commonly, efficiently and effectively are usually the ones who win because you can't see opponents in the jungle unless you ward within it. There might be an ambush waiting there for your whole team and you wouldn't know. Junglers that are coming to gank will be spotted. Objectives in the jungle and river (dragon, Baron, blue buffs) might be being taken and you could steal it, etc. 
Over time you will notice patterns in how the junglers and generally, everyone else walks around the Rift and you can use that to your advantage when it comes to vision control. 

If you you buy a {{item:2043}} (last forever until killed) at the start of the match and place it in the brushes that no one in the enemy usually walks into, it will last really long. These brush spots are:

•The brushes in between the mid lane outer turret tower and the blue buff (for both sides of the map). No one walks through there early, the jungler is too busy trying to clear so he wants the quickest and most efficient path and that's not the right way. 
•The two single patch of circular brushes in the rivers are also good pink ward spots. Its coverage is really wide.
•The tri-brush between bot lane outer turret (blue side) and dragon and the tri-brush between top lane (red side) outer turret and Baron Nashor are good spots to ward depending on which side of the map you are in. The blue team usually has easy control over the tri-brush near bot lane so the blue team should pink ward it. For the red team to reach that spot they would need to overextend, it's more unsafe for the red team to contest vision. 
____
After buying a {{item:2049}} you should sell the {{item:3340}} that you bought at the start of the match and buy a {{item:3341}} to destroy any wards that the enemy might have. {{item:3341}} is also useful for Teemo shrooms and Shaco boxes and those are always good to take down.
This is really helpful! Thank you!!

ill help you if you want. I could spectate your games tell you what your doing wrong and what your building wrong etc add me on kitten0(my smurf) if you want my help. Im on that account more often lately. Im a gold  adc main but i know the other roles pretty well and i know support as well as adc. Bot lane should know both roles equally well
I'll send a request

https://www.youtube.com/user/foxdropLoL

for jungle guides i recommend this dude. He is a diamond player who mains jungle and i found his advice pretty helpful to add jungling to my league repertoire.

Since you already have plenty of people to play with, I'll leave some resources instead.

There are quite a few YouTubers who pump out content for a variety of viewers. For jungle, I would recommend pants are dragon, whose channel name is luigidragon. For general information, Leaguecraft has recorded lectures, power points, etc. for a more academic approach. When you feel you've got a good understanding of the game, look up lastshadow9. He uploads coaching sessions. 

Look up everything you have a question about on the Wiki. It's the best tool you can use.

While I can't actually teach you anything myself given I'm newer than you are I can link you to some videos that I've been watching as of late to try and learn more about the game.

https://www.youtube.com/user/ProfGonGoon/videos?sort=dd&view=0&shelf_id=0 has stuff such as "When to leave lane" along with "trading" and the like.

https://www.youtube.com/user/flexpointlol/playlists is a channel I found yesterday. It has these "spectating" videos where he watches games sent to him and provides feedback along with guides. His rank is Diamond.

https://www.youtube.com/user/HuzzyGames/videos is just overall great. He comments on his own mistakes and uploads his losses too which makes things easy to understand.

Hope it helps, Neptune. If you feel like getting together for a game sometime feel free to add me.
Sent you a friend request. I main support, so I can teach you support (or mid and top, as the other lanes I play frequently).
You can add me if you'd like, always willing to help a pre30 figure the game out

I'd be willing to help you out! 
Add me in client.

I could recommend a few things although I am not the best at the game just a low silver anyway.

Jungle could be a bit challenging without the proper runes but there are a few champions that do decent in the jungle even without runes some that come to mind for me are {{champion:19}}  {{champion:20}} and {{champion:11}} do to some piece of their kit giving decent sustain or atk speed. You could in theory jungle with anyone with enough practice but I would try to get runes before you go to crazy with that.

As for support you have a couple options on what type of playstyle you want to do do you want to be a tank and soak the damage for your adc maybe {{champion:201}}  or {{champion:89}} could fill those roles. Do you want to have decent disengage or have a decent heal or shield so your adc can stay in lane a little longer maybe {{champion:40}} or {{champion:16}} could work for you. And finally you could try to either poke the enemy adc out of lane or burst them down so your adc does not have to do all the damage maybe someone like {{champion:1}} or {{champion:76}} could work for you. Also in theory if a champion has something in their kit that allows them to keep an adc safe they can go support, I usually run {{champion:111}} bot do to his large amount of cc and tankiness.

As with any role or position its down to preference so what I would recommend you do is try a champion out and see if they can fill this position if they do a decent job and you like how they play considering maining them. This game is partly trial and error if you fail you can always try again and see if you can do better.

 Hope this help.
This is really helpful, I took a screenshot, thank you.

Free to play champs are also really nice. 10 new champs you can play for free each week. Right now, Braum and Sejuani are free to play. So you can try them out if you want. Braum for support and Sejuani for jungle. Tryndamere is also free to play at the moment, so maybe you could try jungle with or even top lane if you want to try that lane. His ult makes him unkillable for a few seconds.

Also, http://www.surrenderat20.net/ and http://na.leagueoflegends.com/ are nice sites to use to keep up with what's happening with the game and what changes will be coming to it. There 3 new champ and skins sales every 3-4 days. Twice a week. Every Tuesday and Friday. They overlap on Friday so there's 6 champs/skins on sale until the end of that day. Free to play rotation changes every Tuesday currently. Sales are also usually announced Mondays and Thursdays, the day before they go on sale. The announcement for the next 10 free to play champs is also every Monday. Riot has a pattern with things. Big patches where you usually can't play for a few hours is also usually around Wednesday/Thursday night, mostly Wednesday nights but can change sometimes. Well, every 2 weeks on a Wednesday night. So no patch this week, but there will be next Wednesday. Though it's more like Thursday at 6am, so yeah.

For jungle you would mostly likely want to start of with champs like {{champion:11}} and {{champion:19}} so that you can get the basics of ganking at appropriate times. Then move onto champs like {{champion:5}} {{champion:62}} to practise to farm and see how to either camp a lane (ganking one lane constantly-every few minutes or so.) Make sure then to watch some videos or read some guides before moving onto harder champions that can have a better gank style that fits you. The hardest champs to jungle with would be {{champion:60}} or maybe {{champion:64}} if you're looking for mechanics. 

For supp, there isn't much but {{champion:53}} {{champion:412}} both make a good choice if you want to pull enemies in. Try blitz first then move on to thresh, since thresh has more to do with utility and making sure you land your hook right and know when to go in. When you want to be a tanky, damage absorbing wall for your adc, then go for {{champion:111}} or {{champion:201}} {{champion:89}}  and possibly {{champion:44}} . As for very utility based, skill shot champs, try out {{champion:432}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:143}} . Good supps to poke enemies down to low hp so your adc can kill easily would be {{champion:76}} {{champion:1}}  . For a more defensive and heal champ, go champs like {{champion:16}} {{champion:37}}. The champ that do cc to stop adcs from moving either away or towards you would be {{champion:40}} and {{champion:25}}.
I mained morg in season 4 in a supporting role! add me ! :D I would love to give tips on her, and what items to buy! She is super fun.

I can talk you through any champions you're interested in. Like explain their play style, what items they buy and stuff like that. Or if you want to play bots I could do that. I don't play PvP until the weekends.
Okay!

get to level 30 first and get starter rune pages standard ap and standard ad you can look up what those are when you are 30 but until then jungling is too hard and the game you are playing isnt the real game its just a clusterduck.
